column1: The Promise interface also allows jQuery's Ajax methods, including $.get(), to chain multiple .done(), .fail(), and .always() callbacks on a single request, and even to assign these callbacks after the request may have completed. If the request is already complete, the callback is fired immediately.
Request the test.php page, but ignore the return results.
Request the test.php page and send some additional data along (while still ignoring the return results).
column2: request page and send additional data

column1: Alert the results from requesting test.php (HTML or XML, depending on what was returned).
Alert the results from requesting test.cgi with an additional payload of data (HTML or XML, depending on what was returned).
column2: check for results with additional data

column1: Get another page on the same domain. Outputs to console both the data returned and the type of data returned.
column2: get another page in same domain
